column5: Hey guys. I bought a rod at BPS today but don't know what to use it for. It's a BPS brand rod. 7'6", UltraLite, spinning, glass. It was only 24.99 so I couldn't pass it up. It is the yellow one in case you're wondering. What situations should I use it?  Thanks  Curt
How about pond Trout, Perch and Crappie?
that's what I was sorta thinking. Wow would it work for smaiiles? with it being a 7'6" I think it would handle it.
Use it for everything you want , try it out for diferent situations. I have got 20 pound carp on a 5'6 UL.  I bet that would be a great panfish rod.

throw small crakbaits with it for smallies.  For sure.  I drop shotted with a 5'6 UL this fall and hooked up and landed a 3 pound smallie.  It was fun and I didn't feel the fish was too much for the rod.
drop shotting & casting small jigs like grubs, or even things like beetle spins would be great for that rod.
perfect for trout in tiny tiny streams IMO
